greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of zeta'(-3) (the derivative of Riemann's zeta function at -3).
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.15.1 Generalized Glaisher constants, p. 136-137.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: zeta'(-n) = (BernoulliB(n+1)*HarmonicNumber(n))/(n+1) - log(A(n)), where A(n) is the n-th Bendersky constant, that is the n-th generalized Glaisher constant.
Equals -11/720 + (gamma + log(2*Pi))/120 - 3*Zeta'(4)/(4*Pi^4), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant A001620. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 24 2015
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 18 2015
